metadata.title: CVE-2014-3619 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The __socket_proto_state_machine function in GlusterFS 3.5 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a "00000000"fragment header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.2-1ubuntu1+esm1').
